description: The basemap provides geographic context to the map and scene.
title: baseMap

___elevationLayers.description: Deprecated, use `ground.layers` instead 1. An array of elevationLayer objects defining the basemaps used in the web scene.

$eref.description: ElevationLayer is a tile layer used for rendering elevation in web scenes.
$eref.title: elevationLayer

___visibility.description: Boolean property determining whether the layer is initially visible in the web scene.

___url.description: The URL to the layer.If the layer is not from a web service but rather a feature collection, then the url property is omitted

___listMode.description: To show or hide the elevation layer in the layer list

___title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents. If this is not included, a title is derived from the service.

___id.description: A unique identifying string for the layer

___itemId.description: Optional string containing the item ID of the service if it's registered on ArcGIS Online or your organization's portal.

___baseMapLayers.description: An array of baseMapLayer objects defining the basemaps used in the web scene.

$eref.description: A basemap layer is a layer that provides geographic context to the scene. The following is a list of possible basemap layer types.
$eref.title: baseMapLayer

___title.description: Required string title for the basemap that can be used in a table of contents.

___id.description: A unique identifying string for the basemap.

___transparency.description: The degree of transparency applied to the layer on the client side, where 0 is full transparency and 1 is no transparency.
